Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2018 09:48AM Cyto_Destructo wrote: I got mine removed as soon as they'd let me. It was a lumpy annoyance. The removal was so much easier than the install. I didn't have to stay overnight. I think they used a different anesthetic on me though. I forget the name. Propanol? Commonly referred to as the Michael Jackson drug. It felt so good to have that thing gone. It was a double port so we're talking BULKY. Don't worry, the surgery isn't that bad.
Posts.Title: Power Port, should it stay or should it go? sweetp6217 sweetp6217

Posts.Content: May 29, 2015 06:20AM Cyto_Destructo wrote: Hi everybody, I'm late to the party but I started chemo late April. All was going pretty good until I was diagnosed with a blood clot just before my 3rd treatment. Now taking blood thinners (sub Q, in the stomach). I'll update my profile with the chemo drugs I'm on as I hadn't paid much attention. All I know for sure is it's some cytotoxic BS, and the first 4 are supposed to be the worst. I'll be having the 4th treatment next thursday then get switched to something lighter.
